tasks.title: Set up Next.js project structure
tasks.description: Initialize a Next.js project with the required dependencies and folder structure for the Peep marketing website.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Next.js project using `npx create-next-app@latest peep-website`
2. Set up the following folder structure:
   - `/pages`: For main page routes
   - `/components`: For reusable UI components
   - `/public`: For static assets like images and videos
   - `/styles`: For CSS modules or global styles
3. Install necessary dependencies:
   - `npm install framer-motion` (for animations)
   - `npm install @vercel/analytics` (for tracking metrics)
4. Configure basic Next.js settings in `next.config.js`
5. Set up deployment configuration for Vercel
6. Initialize Git repository for version control
tasks.testStrategy: Verify project structure is correctly set up by running the development server with `npm run dev` and ensuring the application loads without errors. Test deployment to Vercel using a staging environment.

subtasks.title: Initialize Next.js project and set up Git repository
subtasks.description: Create a new Next.js project using the create-next-app command and initialize Git for version control
subtasks.details: Run `npx create-next-app@latest peep-website` to create the project. Accept TypeScript configuration if prompted. Initialize Git repository with `git init`, create a .gitignore file (if not already created), and make an initial commit with `git add .` and `git commit -m "Initial Next.js project setup"`.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the project initializes correctly by running `npm run dev` and confirming the default Next.js page loads in the browser at localhost:3000

subtasks.title: Set up folder structure and organize project files
subtasks.description: Create and organize the required folder structure for components, pages, styles, and public assets
subtasks.details: Ensure the `/pages` directory exists for routing. Create `/components` directory for UI components with subdirectories for layout, shared, and feature-specific components. Set up `/public` directory for static assets including images and videos. Create `/styles` directory for CSS modules or global styles. Add placeholder files in each directory to maintain structure in Git.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all directories are created with proper structure. Ensure placeholder files are committed to Git and the structure matches the requirements specified in the task details.

subtasks.title: Install dependencies and configure deployment settings
subtasks.description: Install required npm packages and configure Next.js and Vercel deployment settings
subtasks.details: Install dependencies with `npm install framer-motion @vercel/analytics`. Configure basic Next.js settings in `next.config.js` including image optimization, internationalization if needed, and any environment variables. Create a `vercel.json` file if custom Vercel deployment configuration is needed. Set up environment variables in a `.env.local` file (add to .gitignore) and document required variables in a `.env.example` file.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify all dependencies are correctly installed by checking package.json. Test that Next.js configuration works by building the project with `npm run build`. Test Vercel deployment by connecting the Git repository to Vercel and deploying to a staging environment.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down the Next.js project setup into subtasks for initial project creation, folder structure setup, and configuration of dependencies and deployment settings.

tasks.title: Implement brand assets and styling
tasks.description: Set up global styling, typography, and import brand assets according to the PRD specifications.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify all brand assets load correctly across browsers. Test that typography and colors match the brand guidelines by visual inspection. Ensure favicon displays correctly in browser tabs.

subtasks.title: Create global CSS file with brand colors and base styling
subtasks.description: Set up the foundation for the site's visual identity by creating a global CSS file with brand colors and base styling elements.
subtasks.details: Create a global.css file in the styles directory. Define CSS variables for brand colors (--white: #FFFFFF, --text: #0A0A0A, --accent-purple: #6E4AFF, --soft-gray: #F3F3F3). Add base styling for common elements like body, main containers, and utility classes for spacing and layout. Link this global CSS file to the application's entry point (_app.js or similar).
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that CSS variables are correctly defined and accessible throughout the application. Test that base styling is applied consistently across different browsers.

subtasks.title: Configure typography with Inter and SF Pro fonts
subtasks.description: Import and configure the typography system using Inter and SF Pro (or similar) fonts to establish a consistent text hierarchy.
subtasks.details: Import Inter and SF Pro fonts either via Google Fonts CDN or by adding local font files to the project. Configure font-family hierarchy in the global CSS with appropriate fallbacks. Create typography classes for different text elements (headings h1-h6, paragraphs, links, etc.) with proper font sizes, weights, and line heights. Ensure text is responsive across different screen sizes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test font loading performance. Verify typography renders correctly across different devices and browsers. Check that font fallbacks work when primary fonts fail to load.

subtasks.title: Import and integrate brand assets and favicon
subtasks.description: Add the Peep bird logo and create favicon from it, setting up proper metadata for the application.
subtasks.details: Add the Peep bird logo in SVG/PNG format to the /public/images/ directory. Create favicon versions in different sizes (16x16, 32x32, 192x192 for PWA support) from the Peep bird logo. Set up metadata in _document.js or _app.js including favicon links, application name, and other relevant meta tags. Create reusable components for brand assets that might be used throughout the application.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all brand assets load correctly across browsers. Test that favicon displays properly in browser tabs and bookmarks. Ensure SVG assets scale appropriately on different screen sizes.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Divide the brand styling implementation into subtasks for global CSS setup, typography configuration, and brand asset integration.

tasks.title: Create responsive layout structure
tasks.description: Implement the responsive layout framework for the landing page, including the header and hero section structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Test responsiveness across multiple device sizes using browser dev tools. Verify that the layout correctly stacks on mobile devices and maintains proper spacing and alignment at all breakpoints.

subtasks.title: Implement base layout component with responsive grid
subtasks.description: Create the Layout.js component with responsive grid structure using CSS Grid or Flexbox that will serve as the foundation for all pages.
subtasks.details: Create the Layout.js component that includes header, main content area, and footer placeholders. Implement the responsive grid using CSS Grid or Flexbox with appropriate container classes. Ensure the layout adapts to different screen sizes with proper spacing and alignment. Include basic styling for the layout containers with CSS modules or styled-components.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the layout structure on different viewport sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile) using browser dev tools. Verify that the grid system properly adjusts to different screen sizes and maintains proper spacing.

subtasks.title: Configure responsive breakpoints and media queries
subtasks.description: Set up the responsive breakpoint system with appropriate media queries for desktop, tablet, and mobile views.
subtasks.details: Create a breakpoints.js file or CSS variables to define the breakpoint values (Desktop: 1200px+, Tablet: 768px-1199px, Mobile: <768px). Implement media query mixins or utility functions that can be reused across components. Configure the responsive behavior for layout transitions between breakpoints. Ensure consistent application of breakpoints throughout the application.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the breakpoint system by resizing the browser window and observing layout changes at each defined breakpoint. Verify smooth transitions between different viewport sizes and confirm that the correct styles are applied at each breakpoint.

subtasks.title: Build responsive hero section with two-column layout
subtasks.description: Implement the hero section component with a responsive two-column layout that stacks on mobile devices.
subtasks.details: Create the HeroSection.js component with left and right content containers. Implement the two-column layout using the grid system established in the base layout. Add responsive behavior to stack the columns vertically on mobile devices. Ensure proper spacing and alignment between the columns at all breakpoints. Add placeholder containers for the text content and video that will be implemented in subsequent tasks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the hero section layout across all breakpoints to verify proper column alignment and spacing. Confirm that the columns stack correctly on mobile devices with appropriate margins and padding. Check that the content containers are properly sized and positioned.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down the responsive layout implementation into subtasks for the overall grid system, responsive breakpoints configuration, and specific component layout structures.

tasks.title: Implement right side hero content with video
tasks.description: Create the right column of the hero section with the app video inside an iPhone mockup frame.
tasks.testStrategy: Test video autoplay functionality across browsers. Verify that the video is properly contained within the iPhone mockup frame. Check that the video is responsive and properly sized across devices. Ensure the video loops correctly.

subtasks.title: Create VideoDisplay component with autoplay functionality
subtasks.description: Implement the VideoDisplay component with autoplay and IntersectionObserver for visibility detection
subtasks.details: Create the VideoDisplay.js component with useRef and useEffect hooks to handle video autoplay. Implement the IntersectionObserver to play the video when it becomes visible in the viewport. Add error handling for browsers that prevent autoplay. Ensure the video is muted, loops continuously, and plays inline.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test autoplay functionality across different browsers. Verify that the video plays when scrolled into view. Check that error handling works correctly when autoplay is prevented.

subtasks.title: Style iPhone mockup frame for video container
subtasks.description: Create the CSS styling for the iPhone 15 Pro mockup frame that will contain the app demo video
subtasks.details: Design the iPhone mockup frame using CSS or an image overlay. Add rounded edges, screen bezels, and a notch to mimic an iPhone 15 Pro. Apply drop shadow effects for depth. Create a soft, blurred background rectangle behind the phone for visual emphasis. Ensure the video fits properly within the mockup frame with appropriate dimensions (350-450px wide on desktop).
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the mockup styling matches iPhone 15 Pro appearance. Test that the video is properly contained within the frame. Check that shadows and visual effects render correctly across browsers.

subtasks.title: Implement responsive behavior for video display
subtasks.description: Ensure the video component and iPhone mockup are responsive across different device sizes
subtasks.details: Create responsive CSS using media queries to adjust the video and iPhone mockup dimensions based on screen size. Implement fluid scaling for mobile devices while maintaining aspect ratio. Optimize the component layout for different viewports (mobile, tablet, desktop). Ensure the video quality remains high while optimizing for performance on mobile devices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test the component across multiple device sizes and orientations. Verify that the video and mockup scale appropriately without distortion. Check loading performance on mobile devices with throttled connections.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Divide the video implementation into subtasks for the video component with autoplay functionality, the iPhone mockup frame styling, and responsive behavior across devices.

tasks.testStrategy: Test that analytics are properly recording page views. Verify that App Store click events are being tracked correctly. Set up a test environment to validate that time on page and bounce rate metrics are being recorded accurately.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down the analytics implementation into subtasks for Vercel Analytics setup, custom event tracking for App Store clicks, and time on page/bounce rate tracking configuration.

tasks.title: Optimize performance and deploy to Vercel
tasks.description: Optimize the website for performance, accessibility, and SEO, then deploy to Vercel.
tasks.details:
1. Optimize images and video:
   - Compress images using Next.js Image component
   - Optimize video file size while maintaining quality
   - Implement lazy loading for below-the-fold content
2. Implement SEO best practices:
   - Add meta tags in `_document.js` or using Next.js Head component
   - Create a sitemap.xml
   - Add Open Graph tags for social sharing
3. Ensure accessibility:
   - Add proper alt text for images
   - Ensure sufficient color contrast
   - Test with keyboard navigation
   - Add aria attributes where needed
4. Performance optimizations:
   - Minimize CSS and JavaScript
   - Implement code splitting
   - Configure caching headers
5. Deploy to Vercel:
   - Connect GitHub repository to Vercel
   - Configure build settings
   - Set up custom domain if available
6. Test final deployment for any issues
tasks.testStrategy: Run Lighthouse audits to verify performance, accessibility, SEO, and best practices scores. Test loading speed across various network conditions. Verify that the site is properly deployed and accessible via the Vercel URL. Test that all functionality works correctly in the production environment.

subtasks.title: Optimize images and videos for performance
subtasks.description: Implement image and video optimization techniques to improve loading times and overall performance.
subtasks.details: Use Next.js Image component to automatically optimize images with proper sizing, formats, and lazy loading. Compress video files using appropriate codecs while maintaining quality. Implement lazy loading for below-the-fold content to improve initial page load times. Test optimizations using Lighthouse and WebPageTest to verify improvements.
subtasks.testStrategy: Compare before and after performance metrics using Lighthouse. Verify that images load properly across different device sizes. Test video playback quality after optimization. Measure Core Web Vitals improvements.

subtasks.title: Implement SEO best practices
subtasks.description: Add necessary SEO elements to improve search engine visibility and social sharing capabilities.
subtasks.details: Add meta tags in `_document.js` or using Next.js Head component for title, description, and keywords. Create a sitemap.xml file and robots.txt for better crawling. Implement Open Graph tags for social media sharing. Add structured data (JSON-LD) for rich snippets. Ensure proper heading hierarchy and semantic HTML throughout the site.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use tools like Lighthouse SEO audit and Google Search Console to verify SEO implementation. Test social sharing previews using Facebook/Twitter debugging tools. Validate structured data using Google's Rich Results Test.

subtasks.title: Ensure accessibility compliance
subtasks.description: Implement accessibility improvements to ensure the website is usable by people with disabilities.
subtasks.details: Add proper alt text for all images. Ensure sufficient color contrast ratios between text and backgrounds. Test and fix keyboard navigation throughout the site. Add appropriate ARIA attributes where needed. Ensure proper focus states for interactive elements. Test with screen readers to verify accessibility. Fix any issues found during testing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run accessibility audits using tools like Lighthouse and axe. Test keyboard navigation through all interactive elements. Verify screen reader compatibility using NVDA or VoiceOver. Ensure the site meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards.

subtasks.title: Deploy to Vercel and configure production settings
subtasks.description: Set up the Vercel deployment process and configure production environment settings for optimal performance.
subtasks.details: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure build settings and environment variables. Set up custom domain if available. Configure caching headers for static assets. Enable Vercel Edge Functions if needed. Implement code splitting and bundle optimization. Set up continuous deployment with preview environments for future updates. Test the production deployment for any issues.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify successful deployment by testing all functionality in the production environment. Test loading speed across various network conditions. Verify that caching is working correctly. Test custom domain configuration and SSL certificate. Run final Lighthouse audit on the production URL.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down the optimization and deployment process into subtasks for image/video optimization, SEO implementation, accessibility improvements, and the Vercel deployment process.
